 '[[Canada]]â[[United States]] [[border]]', officially known as the
 'International Boundary', is the longest international border in the world
 shared between the same pair of countries. The terrestrial boundary (including
 small portions of maritime boundaries on the Atlantic, Pacific, and Arctic
 coasts, as well as the Great Lakes) is long, including shared with Alaska. It
 is Canada's only land border.
